Kapolda Sumut Minta Maaf Kasus Polantas Pukul Sopir Ambulans
04 Nov 2019, 13:59 by Ahmad Arfah Lubis
Medan - Kapolda Sumatera Utara (Sumut) Irjen Agus Andrianto meminta maaf atas kasus polisi lalu lintas (polantas) memukul sopir ambulans di Kota Tebing Tinggi. Kapolda memastikan Brigadir UMP sudah mendapat sanksi internal.
"Saya pribadi mohon maaf kepada masyarakat yang kemarin ada selisih paham sama anggota di lapangan," kata Irjen Agus kepada wartawan di Mapolda Sumut, Jl Sisingamangaraja, Medan, Senin (4/11/2019).
Irjen Agus menegaskan ambulans menjadi salah satu kendaraan yang harus diprioritaskan dalam berlalu lintas. Tapi Irjen Agus menyebut kondisi psikologis polisi tak bisa dikendalikan seluruhnya.
"Namun di lapangan kembali psikologis anggota kita tidak bisa kendalikan satu-satu. Bahkan kita evaluasi anggota tersebut kita pindahkan ke staf biasa," ujar dia.
"Sekali lagi saya mohon maaf yang terjadi di lapangan. Kita semua selalu mengarahkan kepada anggota untuk melakukan yang baik kepada masyarakat," sambung Irjen Agus.
Oknum polisi yang memukul sopir ambulans sudah berdamai. Tetapi Brigadir UMP akan menjalani proses sidang disiplin untuk mempertanggungjawabkan sikapnya.
Kapolres Tebing Tinggi AKBP Sunadi sebelumnya mengatakan, sebagai anggota Polri, sikap Brigadir UMP tak mencerminkan budaya senyum, sapa, salam (3S). Sikapnya juga dinilai tak menunjukkan sosok polisi yang profesional, modern, tepercaya (promoter).

North Sumatra Police Chief Apologizes Cases of Traffic Police Hit Ambulance Drivers
04 Nov 2019, 13:59 by Ahmad Arfah Lubis
Medan - North Sumatra Police Chief Inspector General Agus Andrianto apologized for the traffic police case (polantas) hitting an ambulance driver in Tebing Tinggi City. The Kapolda ensured that the UMP Brigadier had received internal sanctions.
"I personally apologize to the public yesterday for a difference in understanding with members in the field," Inspector General Agus told reporters at the North Sumatra Police Headquarters, Jl Sisingamangaraja, Medan, Monday (11/04/2019).
Inspector General Agus stressed that the ambulance was one of the vehicles that had to be prioritized in traffic. But Inspector General Agus said that the psychological condition of the police could not be fully controlled.
"But in the field of psychological return our members can not control one by one. In fact we evaluate the members we transfer to ordinary staff," he said.
"Once again I apologize that happened in the field. We all always direct the members to do good to the community," continued Inspector General Agus.
The police who beat the ambulance driver made peace. But the UMP Brigadier will undergo a disciplinary hearing process to account for his attitude.
Tebing Tinggi Police Chief Adjunct Senior Commissioner Sunadi previously said, as a member of the National Police, the attitude of the UMP Brigadier did not reflect the culture of smiles, greetings, greetings (3S). His attitude was also considered not to show the figure of a professional, modern, trusted police (promoter).
